result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas K Mosay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Any bond posted to be applied to costs and surcharges with any balance refunded to the person who posted it.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Huber privileges and good time granted.

Defendant Nicholas K Mosay in court with attorney Richard L Yonko.  Defendant Nicholas K Mosay in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF118, 14CM126 and 14CM216 called.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CF118
Count 1 - Guilty plea
Count 2 - DRI

14CM126 - Guilty plea

14CM216 - Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  11:12 State relates 11:16 Attorney Yonko relates 11:18 Defendant relates 11:21 Court relates and orders:

14CF118
6 months jail - Credit for 30 days - Huber privileges and good time granted
Statutory costs and applicable surcharges - 60 DTP

14CM126
3 months jail - Consecutive to 14CF118 and any sentence he is currently serving - Huber privileges and good time granted
Statutory costs and applicable surcharges - 60 DTP

14CM216
30 days jail - Consecutive to 14CF118, 14CM126 and any sentence he is currently serving - Huber privileges and good time granted
Statutory costs and applicable surcharges - 60 DTP

Attorney Yonko requests bond forfeiture be addressed.  Court orders any bond posted be applied to costs and surcharges ordered.  Any balance to be refunded to person who posted it.
and Motion to Forfeit Bond. State's.

THIS BOND COVERS BOTH CASES 14CM126 AND 14CF118

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with Lavina C. or Jamie M.
Do not operate Motor vehicle.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises.
Curfew of 10PM to 6AM to be at address of 1615 State Hwy 46, Balsam Lake WI.

5/13/2014 - THIS BOND IS AMENDED FROM A $2,500.00 CASH BOND TO A $500.00 CASH BOND. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Nicholas K Mosay in court with attorney Richard L Yonko who appears by phone.  Defendant Nicholas K Mosay in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
